meanings.sent1: The school was underfunding its art program, so the students had limited supplies.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to underfund the healthcare system, causing long wait times.
meanings.sent3: The underfunding of the party decorations led to a very minimalist birthday celebration.
meanings.sent4: The lack of financial support was underfunding the growth of small businesses in the area.
meanings.sent5: The underfunding of the project resulted in delays and incomplete work.

meanings.definition: The act of not providing enough funding.
meanings.sent1: The underfunding of the charity event left many programs without resources.
meanings.sent2: The underfunding of the museum led to limited exhibits and staff cuts.
meanings.sent3: The underfunding of the picnic made it more of a potluck gathering.
meanings.sent4: The underfunding of the research project stifled its progress and potential discoveries.
meanings.sent5: The underfunding of the renovation project resulted in unfinished rooms and shoddy workmanship.
